reviewText: Purchased this and Moto 4 for my son and the feedback is "It's sick!  Makes me want to ride!"  Great footage of various dirtbike riders in various fields of riding.  Will be watched over and over in the "young man cave."

Warren miller meets dirt bikes, it's fun being able to watch how hard people are getting after it.

Extra words are lame.

My kids love the movie. Especially since Taylor Roberts lives down the street and they show him leaving his house and riding on our trails.  They enjoyed all parts of the movie as it has skits from all different riders and different terrain from all over. We all enjoy watching it!
This is a pretty expensive DVD and not a lot of substance to it. My daughter has Moto 1 and 2 and even she said Moto 3 is lacking. Think of saving your money on this one.
Sweet movie!
As good as all the other Moto movies!
not what I expected.
Great for the kids...
all good
Good info!!
It's a moto movie. Always great
Very good.
Boring repetitive and badly edited. Looks and feels like it was put together by 14 year old boyd
The third in the series, have thoroughly enjoyed them all. Excellent riding footage, insight, etc - highly recommend.
Great movie !!!
Shut it off after three minutes, boring.
I personally love this kind of video.  I just wish the other Moto's were free on Prime.
Grandchildren are motorheads when I need them to quiet down for a while they will watch this quietly for hours.....the music is a bit irritating for me after while!
Fun movie to watch showcasing some great motorcross stunts.  Also shows you how hard you have to practice to become a professional!
Great movie.
Great movie
Very cool insight into motocross - great shooting!
So much braappping !!
Pretty good some moments where the content could be better.
Braaaap!
kinda neat shows different riders and different tracks  more into the riders
Great movie, lots of different kinds of dirt bike coverage
These guys are crazy! Very good riding
Good to see some of today's biggest stars a few years ago.  Ken R, Adam C, KW and Ryan V.
Loved it. Great movie.
What's not to love
Good quality movie.
Reasonably Good show if you're into that sort of thing. Good for demonstrating skills that riders can aspire to.
Very well done.
amazing
Amazing shots, I want to be there!
Great documentary. I just wish that I could get it on DVD instead of a download especially for $9.99

The Makers of Moto3 are incredible . For me (a Dirt Bike Enthusiast) , there couldn't be a more enjoyable or more entertaining way to spend an hour . The photography is so great and the interviewing so sincere that You feel like thanking the Riders next time You them at a Race . We have Group Rides up at my NoCal Cabin and I can't wait to share this (on the 65 inch LED) with the Guys and Gals that Ride here ..
awesome moto movie. Fun to watch, loved the entire thing. Go for it, watch it, worth the time. Good times

I have every Moto, 1,2,3,4 and 5.  They are all great because they display totally differnt disciplines of riding.  Not everyone love the track or the woods or the desert.  These movies show how many vastly different ways there are to enjoy motorcycles.  I love it.
Lots of great moto footage.  Guess I get a bit tired of seeing one crossed-up jump after another.  Like the addition of trail riding segments in some awesome locations.  Moto 4 is better IMO.
great predecessor to Moto4 & a must view for moto cross fans of all ages. great footage of the best in moto cross.
THis is one of my favorite movies for moto. My grand kids are riders and this is one thing we can watch together
makes you want to go out redline the bike and rip s*** up and not give a damn about nuttin
We both enjoyed this movie. Lots of crazy lots of action. Being I am 55 and used to ride, it sparked the passion again but I am being told I am crazy. And they didn't think I knew that already!
Good riding sessions, great cinematography!  They didn't over use camera effects. Only thing that was lame was the Ken Roczen segment... No guy should ever wear eye liner.
fun romp watching the upcoming pros ride dirt. Pretty much exactly what it says it is. Great jumps and lots of mud.
This is a great movie.  I am very impressed by its diversity of riding and riders.  The talent caught here is totally huge, the camera work is just as good as the riding, almost.
Enjoyed this movie, great segment on JB his track is sic and liked the enduro-X. Anything with KW in it is great.

If you want it with the pressure on, and the way some get to that point in life. Then this MOTO movie is for you. Very well put together like the classic (On Any Sunday). I like how it progresses from the first one. This is one of the fastest most demanding motor sports in the world, like Formula One and INDY cars. The riders take great risk, weather they are just having fun, doing drills or practice you get to see a lot of it.
ENJOY
loved this movie! i grew up in a family with motocross racers. this movie brought back good memories. great movie
Very interesting to watch and see just how much work goes into being one of the top riders and still has rewatch ability and still enjoy it high recommended
Nice perspectives, interviews, and film work for the sports various disciplines and many of its top stars.  Worth a view for anyone with an interest in the sport.
It's a good flick if you like motorcycles. I watched it for free with Amazon Prime.  Much of this video was shot at the guy's private tracks at their homes and on the trails.
Not much different  than the others.  Fun to watch.  Talented folks on the bikes for sure.
If you like motocross this vid is a must see.
Absolutely awesome!!!
Love it!
Cool
Great
Great Moto movie!
Keeps my grandson entertained for hours!
Great movie, moto for life!!
It was OK.
